relatedanime.anime: Chihayafuru 2: Waga Mi Yo ni Furu Nagame Seshi Ma ni

recommendations.recommendation: Tournament arc chases tournament arc, with only four non-tournament episodes (plus a recap). Grows somewhat tiresome towards the middle, but picks up again. Like before, the characters are the reason to watch. In terms of story progression, it`s still a league behind S1.
It`s as great as the first season. Nice continuation. I love it! Can`t wait for the 3rd season.

anime.description: After an exciting year for the Mizusawa High School karuta club, a new semester begins as two new members join the group. More passionate than ever for the ancient card game, http://anidb.net/ch35739 [Chihaya] sets ambitious goals for herself and for her friends. Continuation of the first series. Chihaya and her friends have entered their second year of high school, and they are anxious to recruit new first year members for the karuta club and to strengthen their team. However, the new members don`t seem to share Chihaya`s passion for karuta, and a potential rival for http://anidb.net/ch35740 [Taichi]`s affections appears. Source: ANN

tag.name: maintenance tags
tag.description: These tags are used for maintenance.

tag.name: naive
tag.description: A naive (also spelled naïve, keeping its French diacritic) person lacks worldly knowledge, experience, wisdom, understanding, or judgement.

tag.name: high school
tag.description: A secondary school that usually contains grades 10 through 12 in Japan, or 9 through 12 in America.

tag.name: karuta
tag.description: Karuta (かるた, loaned from the Portuguese word meaning "card", carta) is a Japanese card game. The basic idea of any karuta game is to be able to quickly determine which card out of an array of cards is required and then to grab the card before it is grabbed by an opponent. There are various types of cards which can be used to play karuta. It is also possible to play this game using two standard decks of playing cards. There are two kinds of cards used in karuta. One kind is yomifuda (読札) or "reading cards", and the other is torifuda (取り札) or "grabbing cards". As they were denoted, the words in the yomifuda are read and players will have to find its associated torifuda before anybody else does.

tag.name: dynamic
tag.description: Some of the central structural elements in anime are: Plot Continuity How does the plot or several plots unfold. Are they a strictly linear retelling of one big continuing story, a serial, possibly with several side stories, or is the content chopped into a set of unconnected episodes, only sharing the same setting and characters? Stereotype Characters Then there is the question of the character set presentation. Is it completely original, or is it your usual stereotypical character cast. Both choices have their merit, for example it would not really make much sense to reinvent the wheel for a harem anime. Fans of that genre come to expect their favourite stereotype protagonists. Plot Twists Finally there is the question of how complex the plot / the story unfolds. Are there side-plots that merge into the main plot leading to unexpected plot twists, or is the anime quite predictable? The latter would not be appropriate for detective stories. In harem anime on the other hand a foreseeable outcome is actually something the fans will come to expect.

tag.name: target audience
tag.description: Anime, like everything else in the modern world, is targeted towards specific audiences, both implicitly by the creators and overtly by the marketing. While categories are associated with specific sex and age groups, this is not a bar on the anime being enjoyed by people who don`t fit into that band; not only do crossover titles exist, but the categories also have a considerable following outside their main demographic, and a person might as well enjoy anime from all categories. Still, does not invalidate the usefulness of marking a title as one of the categories; the same themes will likely be treated differently in anime geared for different audiences. Only one should not jump the gun and assume that a title will be more or less serious or present content in this or that way due to its target audience, or conversely assume the target audience on the content and its presentation alone. As such, the audience categories help form a broad impression of how a title might work with the announced themes, but offer little to no in-depth information about specific content or its treatment. The audience categories originate from manga magazines, which group titles of a same intended audience into a magazine that is advertised as belonging to that category, and so manga-based anime will have the category from their parent work. As for anime based on other works, the audience is often debatable, but comparing information such as time slot to the manga-based anime generally helps figure out the most likely possibility. If the parent material was classified under multiple audiences over time (for example, it was originally shounen, but then as the plot changed and became more mature, it was reclassified as seinen), and the anime adapts parent material time periods covering multiple audiences, we tag all audiences covered by the anime adaptation.

tag.name: themes
tag.description: Themes describe the very central elements important to the anime stories. They set the backdrop against which the protagonists must face their challenges. Be it School Life, present Daily Life, Military action, Cyberpunk, Law and Order detective work, Sports, or the Underworld. These are only but a few of the more typical backgrounds for anime plots. Add to that a Conspiracy setting with a possible tragic outcome, the Themes span most of the imaginable subject matter relevant to anime.

tag.name: original work
tag.description: What the anime is based on! This is given as the original work credit in the OP. Mostly of academic interest, but a useful bit of info, hinting at the possible depth of story.

tag.name: setting
tag.description: The setting describes in what time and place an anime takes place. To a certain extent it describes what you can expect from the world in the anime.

tag.name: elements
tag.description: Next to Themes setting the backdrop for the protagonists in anime, there are the more detailed plot Elements that centre on character interactions: "What do characters do to each other or what is done to them?". Is it violent Action, an awe-inspiring Adventure in a foreign place, the gripping life of a Detective, a slapstick Comedy, an Ecchi Harem anime, a SciFi epic, or some Fantasy travelling adventure?

tag.name: time
tag.description: This placeholder lists different epochs in human history and more vague but important timelines such as the future, the present and the past.

tag.name: place
tag.description: The places the anime can take place in. Includes more specific places such as a country on Earth, as well as more general places such as a dystopia or a mirror world.

tag.name: josei
tag.description: In the context of manga and associated media, the word josei refers to a female audience roughly between the ages of 15 and 44. In Japanese, the word means simply "woman", and has no anime/manga-related connotations at all. It does not comprise a style or a genre per se, but rather indicates the publisher`s intended target demographic.

tag.name: present
tag.description: Somewhere between past and future.

tag.name: Earth
tag.description: The Earth is the third planet from the Sun, and the densest and fifth-largest of the eight planets in the Solar System. It is in effect a ball of hot mud, but on the surface it`s cold enough, so most of us live on it (or are supposed to). It is circa 4.5 billion years old, and, unless we humans succeed in destroying it over the next couple of centuries, it is expected to last for quite another while, though the changes in the Sun`s emissions due to its aging will likely cause the extinction of everything; the species of earthlings are guaranteed to die, even if we fail to kill them -- unless, of course, we find ourselves another planet and figure out a way to take everything there. Our little planet on a corner of this galaxy may mean nothing in the grand scheme of things, but to its inhabitants it is their home, so, as a species, we cherish it dearly, to the point many cultures even to this day deify it. Being the home to the human civilizations, the Earth is the main setting of most fiction, be it anime or otherwise, but not only are many titles set in other places, such as unrelated fantasy worlds, in a considerable number of fictional titles the Earth is actually destroyed by aggressive alien invaders.

tag.name: school clubs
tag.description: Even though school clubs in Japan are not mandatory, there is some pressure from the social grid (e.g. fellow students, teachers) to participate in some kind of after-school activity, be it in sports or arts. Colleges also have clubs. As a comedy element in anime, some students have joined too many clubs, and are thus constantly stressed out. There is also the element of social commentary, making it clear that you have to join a club, if you want to be part of the class. Since self-founded clubs need at least 3 members, the desperate search and advertising for new members can be cause for hilarity in anime.

tag.name: Japan
tag.description: Japan is a sovereign island nation in East Asia. Located in the Pacific Ocean, it lies off the eastern coast of the Asian mainland and stretches from the Sea of Okhotsk in the north to the East China Sea and China in the southwest. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: Tokyo
tag.description: Tokyo, officially Tokyo Metropolis, is the capital city of Japan and one of its 47 prefectures. The Greater Tokyo Area is the most populous metropolitan area in the world. It is the seat of the Emperor of Japan and the Japanese government. Tokyo is in the Kantou region on the southeastern side of the main island Honshu and includes the Izu Islands and Ogasawara Islands. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: slow when it comes to love
tag.description: The main protagonists in this anime have a very hard time trying to express their feelings to each other. They simply will not finally confess their love. In some cases this romance element is based on unrequited love, or an absurd amount of shyness.

tag.name: unrequited love
tag.description: At least one character has a romantic interest in another one, but the feelings are not returned. This is the cornerstone of all love triangles or love polygons.

tag.name: love polygon
tag.description: A love polygon refers to a romantic relationship involving n people. Although a love triangle is not limited to just heterosexual relationships, in anime, it usually deals with two females liking one male and vice versa.

tag.name: plot continuity
tag.description: Consistency of the characteristics of persons, plot, objects, places and events seen by the viewer. A single linear focused plot is highly continuous. A truly random plot is highly discontinuous.

tag.name: manga
tag.description: Manga is the lifeblood that drives the anime industry. Everything and its mother is based on manga. However! There are exceptions where the manga was not the basis for the anime. It`s common practice to make manga adaptations of many popular anime, there`s a manga based on Evangelion, and two (one shounen and one shoujo) based on each of Escaflowne and Mahou Tsukai Tai. Also it`s quite common to release manga and anime versions of a story in parallel, for instance Nadesico and Shoujo Kakumei Utena. There are also cases where an anime continues in a manga, as in the case of Angel Beats! and Angel Beats: Heaven`s Door, or reverse. See also http://anidb.net/t6493 [manhua] and http://anidb.net/t5010 [manhwa].

tag.name: Asia
tag.description: Asia is Earth`s largest and most populous continent, located primarily in the eastern and northern hemispheres and sharing the continental landmass of Eurasia with the continent of Europe. Asia covers an area of 44,579,000 square kilometers, about 30% of Earth`s total land area and 8.7% of the Earth`s total surface area. The continent, which has long been home to the majority of the human population, was the site of many of the first civilizations. Asia is notable for not only its overall large size and population, but also dense and large settlements as well as vast barely populated regions within the continent of 4.4 billion people. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: comedy
tag.description: Anime whose central struggle causes hilarious results. These stories are built upon funny characters, situations and events. A comedy anime is laced with humour and sets out to provoke laughter from the audience. Japanese humour can be a bit strange to westerners, so if you`re new to this type of humour, just bear with it; it`ll most likely grow on you if you`re a fan of other kinds of comedy.

tag.name: romance
tag.description: Romance describes a story that deals with love between two or more characters typically also having an optimistic ending. Romance is also a difficulty encountered when creating a harem.

tag.name: friendship
tag.description: The feeling of trust, kindness, and friendship between a group of high school students for example, is a central theme of this anime.

tag.name: daily life
tag.description: The antics of the protagonists do not take place in some exotic setting or time, but in everyday life. When not "at the job" this means getting up in the morning, making meals, house cleaning, going shopping or out to eat, visiting the bath house or spa, leisure activities in the spare time, etc. The time "on the job" for students is School Life, for others working in their profession. Daily Life is basically a synonym for everything normal, repetitive, and trivial happening to your average person.

tag.name: school life
tag.description: Since a large part of the anime audience still takes part in school life or is visiting college, it is only natural to choose a setting the audience can identify with, be it elementary, middle, or high school. For the older viewers a college setting with more mature real-life problems is appropriate. And since clubs take up so much time in the lives of students, these are obviously also important.

tag.name: sports
tag.description: Sports anime revolves around a recreational physical activity or skill. In addition they often adhere to certain genre conventions, the emphasis on training and practice in preparation for competition, characters desire for self improvement, and pursuit of a specific goal.

tag.name: coming of age
tag.description: In the strict sense the Coming of age describes a young person`s transition from adolescence to adulthood. In anime the term is used in a more general sense where the protagonists have to face a challenge, make an important decision in their life, take on responsibility, or learn a lesson, and by overcoming these obstacles they reach a higher level of maturity.

tag.name: unsorted
tag.description: a bunch of tags that still need to be either deleted or moved into proper places.

tag.name: aim for the top
tag.description: This can be a positive or negative plot device. A character may strive to become the best in an altruistic way (e.g. best healer, most widely learned master), or it can be quite banal and primitive (e.g. challenged delinquents wanting to be the strongest fighters). Alas in fighting anime the latter usually prevails.

tag.name: competition
tag.description: Some sort of confrontation occurs in this show. The protagonists "duke it out" via various competitions.

tag.name: talking is a free action
tag.description: Time in comics is flexible. Each panel shows a single event, which is usually accompanied by a length of dialog, which must take some time to say. This disparity is usually accepted if it isn`t taken to extremes. But often, characters will exposit when it`s most needed: at the story`s climax, when both the intricacies of the plot and the intensity of action hit their highest. While the Heroes Outrun the Fireball, Mr. Exposition might explain why the Evil Overlord`s death caused the explosion. The Action Girl can deliver impressive lectures on why the monster`s Achilles` Heel will work, while still engaging in Waif-Fu. The Superhero can quip to his heart`s content and explain his abilities while dueling one insignificant mobster, or deliver a Kirk Summation during the course of a single Finishing Move. Sometimes even apparent mere mortals can give a lecture on what is happening when it would be a much better idea to simply run like hell. Without stopping to breathe, apparently. Source: TvTrope

tag.name: hard work and guts
tag.description: One of the character`s motto in the anime. Because there is nothing that cannot be achieved by hard work and guts.

tag.name: adapted into JDrama
tag.description: This anime is a http://anidb.net/t2797 [new original work], and it has been adapted into a JDrama. A JDrama (Japanese drama), also called "terebi dorama" ("television drama") or "dorama" for short, is a Japanese live action television series. Japan produces many drama series every year, from a huge variety of genres. Like anime, they generally air in three-month seasons or multiples thereof, with new shows airing every season. Some kinds of drama, especially the morning or afternoon ones, tend to be broadcast daily, while evening ones tend to be broadcast weekly, also like anime. In exceedingly rare instances, a specific episode of a new original work anime can also be adapted.

tag.name: Hyakunin Isshu
tag.description: A traditional anthology style of compiling Japanese waka poetry where each contributor writes one poem for the anthology. Literally, it translates to "one hundred people, one poem". It also refers to the card game of uta-garuta, which uses a deck composed of poems from one such anthology.

tag.name: flashback
tag.description: A flashback is a moment in which someone remembers events from their past. In fiction, flashbacks are used primarily to give insight into a character`s mind or to reveal information which had been previously kept from the audience. They normally consist essentially of new content; in some cases, they may also consist of short snippets of already displayed content, as in http://anidb.net/ch23266 [Okabe Rintarou]`s flashbacks in http://anidb.net/a7729 [Steins;Gate], but even in these cases the flashbacks are used to look into what the character is thinking. As such, they are different from and should not be confused with recaps, which are old content being shown again for no particular purpose other than padding or reminding the audience of the events up to that point. As a rule of thumb, to qualify as a flashback, the scene must advance the show`s content in some way or form; anything else is just a recap.

tag.name: motivational anime
tag.description: The anime motivates doing something which is shown in the show (for example club activity, sports, choosing a job, a hobby etc).

tag.name: heart-warming
tag.description: The story and its characters give off good vibes — includes elevated feelings of affection such as tenderness, sympathy and love, all in one package. The kind of anime which leaves you with a warm feeling inside and you can not stop smiling while watching it.

tag.name: tournament
tag.description: A competition involving a large number of participants. Such competitions may range from friendly, moderated sporting events to anything-goes, all-out fights to the death. All participants take part in the tournament in want or need of the final goal and possible prizes; which depending on genre, may range from a boastful record at school to great riches and/or the granting of a wish. Depending on the type of tournament, contestants will either act alone, be permitted a team, or construct a team of chance throughout the ongoing competition.

tag.name: following one`s dream
tag.description: No matter what the hardships may be, at least one of the protagonists in this anime is following her/his dream. Examples: To become a professional athlete, a musician, a painter or the ruler of this world!

tag.name: intact family
tag.description: The main character`s family is a so-called "nuclear family". Wherein both parents are alive and present in his or her life. This is actually relatively rare for anime, where "parental abandonment" is the norm.

tag.name: rivalry
tag.description: Quite broadly used term describing a conflict, contest, struggle, or opposition of some sort. Typical examples: The mostly comedic rivalry for the love of a protagonist in a harem anime (love polygon), the more "mindless" battles between wannabe delinquents in a school fighting anime, or the struggle between good & evil in an epic conflict for world domination.

tag.name: manly tears
tag.description: Somewhere down the line, it became the "norm" that boys don`t cry. The scenario does not matter; shedding tears is the ultimate no-no in terms of what you can and cannot do as a man (at least in the West, anyway). But there comes a time when a man`s emotions do get the better of him, and they pour forth - as prerequisite an impassioned speech may or may not be present - by cascading down his cheeks. These are what we like to call "manly tears". Extremely powerful. Not limited but often used in hot-blooded / super robot shows. Examples include Yuusha Ou GaoGaiGar, Getter Robo and Tengen Toppa Gurren Lagann. The opposite of manly tears are "girly tears".

tag.name: visible aura
tag.description: Characters are surrounded by a visible energy field usually representing inner strength, but not restricted to only that.

tag.name: girly tears
tag.description: Usually girly tears are the ones not shed by men (duh). Like when a (stereotypical) girl watches something and cries her makeup out, a (stereotypical) dude just says, proclaiming his masculinity: "Meh, yet another soap opera bulls..t, I`ll be in my garage fixing my ride while playing heavy metal on a burning guitar ...with my teeth! And where`s my beer, woman?". So that`s how it goes: girly tears are for girls and sissies! Chuck Norris forbid a guy would weep watching something that has this tag! Now 20 push-ups! P.S. The opposite of "manly tears". Or is it? Let`s face it - it`s all subjective (and relative, and context-dependent).

tag.name: TO BE MOVED TO EPISODE
tag.description: Tags under this parent tag are going to be moved to episode tags and removed from the anime they`re currently assigned to. They will be blocked from the anime system once that move is complete. Please help with that job if you know what episodes they should be assigned to.

tag.name: TO BE MOVED TO CHARACTER
tag.description: Tags under this parent tag are going to be moved to character tags and removed from the anime they`re currently assigned to. They will be blocked from the anime system once that move is complete. Please help with that job if you know what characters they should be assigned to.

tag.name: technical aspects
tag.description: It may sometimes be useful to know about technical aspects of a show, such as information about its broadcasting or censorship. Such information can be found here.

tag.name: card games
tag.description: A card game is any game using playing cards as the primary device with which the game is played, be they traditional or game-specific. Countless card games exist, including families of related games (such as poker). A small number of card games played with traditional decks have formally standardized rules, but most are folk games whose rules vary by region, culture, and person. Many games that are not generally placed in the family of card games do in fact use cards for some aspect of their gameplay. Similarly, some games that are placed in the card game genre involve a board. The distinction is that the gameplay of a card game primarily depends on the use of the cards by players (the board is simply a guide for scorekeeping or for card placement), while board games (the principal non-card game genre to use cards) generally focus on the players` positions on the board, and use the cards for some secondary purpose.

tag.name: tropes
tag.description: A trope is a commonly recurring literary and rhetorical devices, motifs or clichés in creative works. This use is a broader redefining of a literary trope, the use of figurative language, via word, phrase, or even an image, for artistic effect, such as using a figure of speech. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: tales
tag.description: Tales are stories told time and again and passed down from generation to generation, and some of those show up in anime not just once or twice, but several times.

tag.name: adapted into other media
tag.description: This anime is a http://anidb.net/t2797 [new original work], and it has been adapted into other media formats. In exceedingly rare instances, a specific episode of a new original work anime can also be adapted.

character.name: Ayase Chitose
character.description: Ayase Chitose is Chihaya`s older sister. She works as a model.

character.name: Miyauchi Taeko
character.description: Miyauchi Taeko is a teacher of chemistry at Mizusawa high school. She is the adviser of tennis club and karuta club.

character.name: Wataya Mari
character.description: Wataya Mari is Arata`s mother.

character.name: Mashima Reiko
character.description: Mashima Reiko is Taichi`s mother. Chihaya calls her Mrs. Pressure, because she gets angry if Taichi doesn`t excel at everything.

character.name: Ayase Chieko
character.description: Ayase Chieko is Chihaya`s mother.

character.name: Harada Hideo
character.description: Harada-sensei is in charge of Shiranami Karuta Center.

character.name: Nishida Yuusei
character.description: Nishida Yuusei at elementary school.

character.name: Wataya Akira
character.description: Wataya Akira is Arata`s father.

character.name: Wataya Hajime
character.description: Wataya Hajime is a grandfather of Arata. He taught Arata how to to play karuta. He also was a Karuta Master.

character.name: Sudou Akihito
character.description: Sudou Akito is a member of Hokuou Academy karuta club. He was opponent of Ayase at final round of prefectural tournament. A year later he`s a reader (yomite) at final round of Tokyo High School Regionals.

character.name: Kinashi Hiro
character.description: Kinashi Hiro meets with Chihaya and others at prefectural tournament. He is a member of Hokuou Academy karuta club. A year later he`s the opponent of Mashima at final round of Tokyo High School Regionals.

character.name: Tsuboguchi Hiroshi
character.description: Tsuboguchi Hiroshi is a member of Shiranami Karuta Center.

character.name: Takuma
character.description: Takuma is a member of Hokuou Academy karuta club. He was the opponent of Komano at final round of prefectural tournament. A year later he`s again Komano`s opponent at final round of Tokyo High School Regionals.

character.name: Mochida Futoshi
character.description: Mochida Futoshi is a coach of Hokuou Academy karuta club.

character.name: Amakasu Nayuta
character.description: Amakasu Nayuta is a member of Hokuou Academy karuta club. He was opponent of Nishida (Nikuman-kun) at final round of prefectural tournament. A year later he`s Chihaya`s opponent at final round of Tokyo High School Regionals.

character.name: Ayase Kenji
character.description: Ayase Kenji is Chihaya`s father.

character.name: Yoshioka-sensei
character.description: Yoshioka is one of the tournament at Omi Jingu staff members.

character.name: Kawauchi Shouji
character.description: Kawauchi Shouji is Arata`s classmate from junior high school. He is an A class player of karuta.

character.name: Ooe Rieko
character.description: Ooe Rieko is Kanade`s mother. She owns the shop with traditional clothes which she lends to Mizusawa Karuta club on tournaments because she is a big supporter of them.

character.name: Wakamiya Shinobu
character.description: Wakamiya Shinobu is Chihaya`s second opponent in individual tournament at Omi Jingu. She is the current Queen of Karuta and also the youngest Queen in history.

character.name: Kuriyama Isami
character.description: Kuriyama-sensei is a president of Fukui Nagumo Society.

character.name: Nishida Yukari
character.description: Nishida`s (Nikuman) sister.

character.name: Murao Shin`ichi
character.description: Murao Shin`ichi is a member of Nagumo Society in Fukui. He is A Class player.

character.name: Kitano-sensei
character.description: Kitano-sensei is a president of Suihoku Society. He doesn`t get on with Harada.

character.name: Yamamoto Yumi
character.description: Yamamoto Yumi is an adult player of Karuta. She is former Queen and member of Suihoku Society.

character.name: Shinobu no Sobo
character.description: Shinobu`s grandmother.

character.name: Suou Hisashi
character.description: Suou Hisashi is the current Meijin (Master) of Karuta. He began karuta in college and took three years to take the title of Meijin. His favourite food is sweets.

character.name: Ise Daijirou
character.description: Ise Daijirou is a headmaster of Kyouto Myoujo karuta Society.

character.name: Yamashiro Kyouko
character.description: Yamashiro Kyouko is a famous yomite and one of a few who can read at Meijin (Master) and Queen tournaments. Current Meijin Suou is a fan of her.

character.name: Fukasaku Tokiji
character.description: Fukasaku Tokiji is a teacher of literature in Class 2-9 (Chihaya`s class).

character.name: Mano Hinako
character.description: Mano Hinako is Sumire`s friend.

character.name: Miyazaki Shiori
character.description: Miyazaki Shiori is Sumire`s friend.

character.name: Sasa Suzuka
character.description: Sasa was the opponent of Taichi at Tokyo High School Regionals. She is from Homei High School.

character.name: Toda Mei
character.description: Toda Mei was the opponent of Komano at Tokyo High School Regionals. She is from Homei High School.

character.name: Mori Takatoshi
character.description: Mori Takatoshi was the opponent of Kanade at Tokyo High School Regionals. He is from Homei High School.

character.name: Takei Eita
character.description: Takei Eita was the opponent of Chihaya at Tokyo High School Regionals. He is from Homei High School.

character.name: Tashiro
character.description: Tashiro is a reader (yomite) at Tokyo High School Regionals. He was just certified as a Class B reader so he is very nervous.

character.name: Nanami Mayu
character.description: Nanami Mayu was the opponent of Nishida at Tokyo High School Regionals. She is from Homei High School.

character.name: Tsukuba Kyoudai
character.description: Younger brothers of Tsukuba Akihiro. They looks as triplets but in fact they are each a year apart - 11, 10 and 9 years old. They admire their big brother a lot.

character.name: Sakura Ayaka
character.description: Sakura is a member of Tomihara West High School karuta club. She was the opponent of Mashima at Tokyo High School Regionals.

character.name: Nakura Kou
character.description: Nakura Kou is a member of Tomihara West High School karuta club. He was the opponent of Ayase at Tokyo High School Regionals.

character.name: Oda Makoto
character.description: Koda is a member of Shuryukan High School karuta club. He was the opponent of Sumire at Tokyo High School Regionals.

character.name: Nawano Yuri
character.description: Nawano is a member of Tomihara West High School karuta club. She was the opponent of Tsukuba at Tokyo High School Regionals.

character.name: Suda Emi
character.description: Suda is a member of Tomihara West High School karuta club. She was the opponent of Komano at Tokyo High School Regionals.

character.name: Kitaoka Satoko
character.description: Kitaoka Satoko is a member of Tomihara West High School karuta club. She was the opponent of Nishida at Tokyo High School Regionals.

character.name: Harano Soujuurou
character.description: Harano Soujuurou is a member of Shuryukan High School karuta club. He was the opponent of Nishida at Tokyo High School Regionals.

character.name: Ariyoshi Keisuke
character.description: Ariyoshi Keisuke is a member of Shuryukan High School karuta club. He was the opponent of Chihaya at Tokyo High School Regionals.

character.name: Masamoto
character.description: Masamoto is a member of Shuryukan High School karuta club. He was the opponent of Kanade at Tokyo High School Regionals.

character.name: Noguchi Masaya
character.description: Noguchi Masaya is a member of Shuryukan High School karuta club. He was the opponent of Mashima at Tokyo High School Regionals.

character.name: Kameda Seihisa
character.description: Kameda is a member of Hokuou Academy karuta club. He was the opponent of Kanade at final round of Tokyo High School Regionals.

character.name: Shiroyama Kouki
character.description: Shiroyama is a member of Hokuou Academy karuta club. He was the opponent of Nishida at final round of Tokyo High School Regionals.

character.name: Matoba-sensei
character.description: Matoba is a teacher at Chihaya`s school. He is an advisor and the conductor of school band.

character.name: Ousaka Megumu
character.description: Ousaka Megumu is a member of First Akashi Girls` High School karuta club and western representative in last year`s Queen match. She was the opponent of Chihaya at The High School National Ogura Hundred Poems Karuta Championship. She is Class A player.

character.name: Anthony Sorb
character.description: Anthony Sorb is a member of Chiba International School of Information Sciences karuta club. He was the opponent of Chihaya at The High School National Ogura Hundred Poems Karuta Championship.

character.name: Napa Payakuarun
character.description: Napa Payakuarun is a member of Chiba International School of Information Sciences karuta club. He was the opponent of Nishida at The High School National Ogura Hundred Poems Karuta Championship.

character.name: Park Kyonso
character.description: Park Kyonso is a member of Chiba International School of Information Sciences karuta club. He was the opponent of Mashima at The High School National Ogura Hundred Poems Karuta Championship.

character.name: Matt Rowan
character.description: Matt Rowan is a member of Chiba International School of Information Sciences karuta club. He was the opponent of Tsukuba at The High School National Ogura Hundred Poems Karuta Championship.

character.name: Rachel Port
character.description: Rachel Port is a member of Chiba International School of Information Sciences karuta club. She was the opponent of Kanade at The High School National Ogura Hundred Poems Karuta Championship.

character.name: Yamai Makoto
character.description: Yamai Makoto is a member of Fujisaki School karuta club. He was the opponent of Komano at the finals of The High School National Ogura Hundred Poems Karuta Championship. He is Class A player.

character.name: Oono Masaki
character.description: Masaki is a member of Fujioka West karuta club.

character.name: Nakayama Manabu
character.description: Nakayama Manabu is a member of Yamaguchi Mioka High School karuta club. He was the opponent of Chihaya at The High School National Ogura Hundred Poems Karuta Championship. He is Quiz Society president and Karuta club Vice-President. He specializes in astronomy.

character.name: Oikawa Tomonari
character.description: Oikawa Tomonari is an advisor of Yamaguchi Mioka High School karuta club.

character.name: Masuoka Masato
character.description: Masuoka Masato is a committee member at The High School National Ogura Hundred Poems Karuta Championship.

character.name: Yamashiro Rion
character.description: Yamashiro Rion is a member and Ace of Fujisaki High School karuta club. She replaced Suzuki Manata in team for finals. She was the opponent of Chihaya at the finals of The High School National Ogura Hundred Poems Karuta Championship. Rion is Class B player.

character.name: Yuube Keiko
character.description: Yuube Keiko is a member of First Akashi Girls` High School karuta club. She was the opponent of Nishida at The High School National Ogura Hundred Poems Karuta Championship. She is Class A player.

character.name: Hayasaka Nene
character.description: Hayasaka Nene is a member of First Akashi Girls` High School karuta club. She was the opponent of Kanade at The High School National Ogura Hundred Poems Karuta Championship.

character.name: Nanase Kokoro
character.description: Nanase is a member of First Akashi Girls` High School karuta club. She was the opponent of Mashima at The High School National Ogura Hundred Poems Karuta Championship.

character.name: Tanimura Natsuki
character.description: Tanimura Natsuki is a member of First Akashi Girls` High School karuta club. She was the opponent of Komano at The High School National Ogura Hundred Poems Karuta Championship.

character.name: Minami Daigorou
character.description: Minami Daigorou is an advisor of First Akashi Girls` High School karuta club.

character.name: Kawabe Zui
character.description: Kawabe Zui is a member of Shouyou High School karuta club. He was the opponent of Nishida at The High School National Ogura Hundred Poems Karuta Championship.

character.name: Tashiro Haruto
character.description: Tashiro Haruto is a member of Shouyou High School karuta club. He was the opponent of Kanade at The High School National Ogura Hundred Poems Karuta Championship.

character.name: Oooka Ayane
character.description: Oooka Ayane is a member of Shouyou High School karuta club. She was the opponent of Tsukuba at The High School National Ogura Hundred Poems Karuta Championship.

character.name: Sano Reo
character.description: Sano Reona is a member of Shouyou High School karuta club. She was the opponent of Mashima at The High School National Ogura Hundred Poems Karuta Championship.

character.name: Sanada Haruki
character.description: Sanada Haruki is a member of Shouyou High School karuta club. He was the opponent of Chihaya at The High School National Ogura Hundred Poems Karuta Championship.

character.name: Hayashi Sousuke
character.description: Hayashi Sousuke is a member of Yamaguchi Mioka High School karuta club. He was the opponent of Mashima at The High School National Ogura Hundred Poems Karuta Championship.

character.name: Toyoda Taichi
character.description: Toyoda Taichi is a member of Yamaguchi Mioka High School karuta club. He was the opponent of Kanade at The High School National Ogura Hundred Poems Karuta Championship.

character.name: Sasaki Makoto
character.description: Sasaki Makoto is a member of Yamaguchi Mioka High School karuta club. He was the opponent of Kanade at The High School National Ogura Hundred Poems Karuta Championship.

character.name: Tokoro Daisuke
character.description: Tokoro Daisuke is a member of Yamaguchi Mioka High School karuta club. He was the opponent of Tsukuba at The High School National Ogura Hundred Poems Karuta Championship.

character.name: Sakurazawa Midori
character.description: Sakurazawa Midori is an advisor of Fujisaki High School karuta club.

character.name: Emuro Ryouga
character.description: Emuro Ryouga is a member of Fujisaki High School karuta club. He was the opponent of Mashima at the finals of The High School National Ogura Hundred Poems Karuta Championship. Emuro is Class A player.

character.name: Ichimura Mitsuki
character.description: Ichimura Mitsuki is a member of Fujisaki High School karuta club. He was the opponent of Tsukuba at the finals of The High School National Ogura Hundred Poems Karuta Championship. He is Class A player.

character.name: Suzuki Manata
character.description: Suzuki Manata is a member of Fujisaki High School karuta club. Twin brother of Kanata. Was replaced by Yamashiro Rion in team for finals. He is Class A player.

character.name: Suzuki Kanata
character.description: Suzuki Kanata is a member of Fujisaki High School karuta club. Twin brother of Manata. He was the opponent of Nishida at the finals of The High School National Ogura Hundred Poems Karuta Championship. He is Class A player.

character.name: Kinoshita Seigo
character.description: Kinoshita Seigo is a member of Jinnan Academy karuta club. He was the opponent of Arata at The High School National Ogura Hundred Poems Karuta Championship when Arata illegally joined Fujioka West karuta club as their player.

character.name: Suzuki Fumiko
character.description: Suzuki Fumiko is an advisor of Jinnan Academy karuta club.

character.name: Natsuwaki Yuuko
character.description: Natsuwaki Yuuko is a member of Jinnan Academy karuta club.

character.name: Mayama Emi
character.description: Mayama Emi is a member of Jinnan Academy karuta club.

character.name: Honma Toyo
character.description: Honma Toyo is a member of Jinnan Academy karuta club.

character.name: Mori Sasage
character.description: Mori Sasage is a member of Photo Club at Akashi First Girls` neighbouring school. Fan of Megumu.

character.name: Hayashi Jin
character.description: Hayashi Jin is a member of Photo Club at Akashi First Girls` neighbouring school. Fan of Megumu.

character.name: Kibayashi Yutaka
character.description: Kibayashi Yutaka is a member of Photo Club at Akashi First Girls` neighbouring school. Fan of Megumu.

character.name: Mashita Yoshiaki
character.description: Mashita Yoshiaki is a chairman of All Japan Karuta Association.

character.name: Hayashida
character.description: Hayashida is a member of Fujisaki High School karuta club.

episode.title: ひとにはつげよ あまのつりぶね
To Tell the People in the Capital That I Make for the Islands
Hito ni wa Tsuge yo Ama no Tsuribune
episode.summary: Be it luck or skill, Tai seems to falter under pressure. The team needs three wins to proceed and their upcoming opponents are new and trained by an old friend. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: つくばねの
Feel Love Deepen
Tsukubane no
episode.summary: It is time for the High School Karuta Championship; the first years are amazed by the skill level of their upperclassman. Wataya continues his goal to the National High School Championships. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: こひすてふ
As My Love First Came
Kohisutefu
episode.summary: A new school year has started and the Karuta club must get new members or face penalties. Discussing the goals of the club, Chihaya discovers the team is not as unified as she thought. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: はなのいろは
So The Flower Has Wilted
Hana no Iro wa
episode.summary: A new school year has started and the Karuta club must get new members or face penalties. Discussing the goals of the club, Chihaya discovers the team is not as unified as she thought. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: たつたのかはの にしきなりけり
To Set the Tatsuta River Ablaze
Tatsuta no Kawa no Nishiki Narikeri
episode.summary: Individually, Mizusawa players have grown, but Hokuo will try to use Mizusawa lack of team playing experience to take back the Tokyo regional trophy. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: なほあまりある むかしなりけり
Be as Dear Now, Those Were the Good Old Days
Nao Amari Aru Mukashi Narikeri
episode.summary: The final two teams in the competition is a repeat of Mizusawa vs. Hokuo. Chihaya wants to challenge them straight up, no tricks. A player on the Hokuo team will make sure it happens. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: みかさのやまに いでしつきかも
Which Shines over Mount Mikasa
Mikasa no Yama ni Ideshi Tsuki kamo
episode.summary: The national championship has begun. Mizusawa High School`s first opponent is a tam of foreigners from the Chiba International School of Information Studies. Chihaya is elated that karuta has become an international sport, but the other members are thrown off by the unfamiliar situation. Will Mizusawa High School be able to secure their first victory on their way to becoming number one in Japan? At the same time, Arata arrives at Omi Jingu alone. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: しるもしらぬも あふさかのせき
They All Exchange Hellos and Goodbyes at the Famous Gates of Afusaka
Shiru mo Shiranu mo Ousaka no Seki
episode.summary: The deal was to get 5 new members for the Karuta club. Chihaya has to figure out a way to keep the room and deal with the band club. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: むらさめの
Rain Takes Longer to Dry
Murasame no
episode.summary: Mizusawa next opponent is a group of genius that has been sweeping the Karuta scene. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: わたのはら
My Only Thought
Wata no Hara
episode.summary: One wrong decision can ruin Arata chance this season to make his comeback… Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: みそぎぞなつの しるしなりける
The Only Sign of Summer
Misogi zo Natsu no Shirushi Narikeru
episode.summary: In the second round of the playoffs, Mizusawa faces off against Akashi Girls First, led by Ousaka Megumu, the West representative in the previous Queen match qualifier. Chihaya falls behind off the bat as Megumu displays speed that she didn`t have before. Will Chihaya be able to use all of her hard work to change the momentum? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: さしもしらじな もゆるおもひを
I Feel As Though My Body Is on Fire with Ibuki Mugwort
Sashimo Shiraji na Moyuru Omoi o
episode.summary: Mizusawa has finally made it to the first round of the High School Championship playoffs. However, Porky says that they should play without Desk-kun. After looking at Desk-kun`s notebook, she agrees that they should leave him out of the lineup. Their opponent is Shoyo High school, representing Kyoto. Will Porky and Desk-kun be able to make peace? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ものやおもふと ひとのとふまで
People Would Always Ask If I Was Pining for Someone
Mono ya Omou to Hito no Tou made
episode.summary: Mizusawa and Akashi match has reached the tipping point and each side starts winning games; the pressure between Chihaya and Megumu have captivated the crowd. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ゆめのかよひぢ ひとめよくらむ
In My Dreams, I Creep Closer to You
Yume no Kayoiji Hitome Yokuran
episode.summary: Chihaya appears to have recovered from her bad start, but Megumu will not let her take consecutive cards. As the players spur on their aces, both sides begin to pull together as teams. Which team will prove to be stronger? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: みゆきまたなむ
Wait for the Emperor`s Return
Miyuki Matanamu
episode.summary: A look back on season 2. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: たごのうらに
No Matter Where I Stand
Tago no Ura ni
episode.summary: Tsukuba finally gets his chance to play due to Kana’s injury, but will he be able to keep his composure in such an important match. Meanwhile, the team members of Fujisaki are waiting to see what player, Coach Sakurazawa will switch for the final match. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: わすれじの
My Fear Is That You Will Forget
Wasureji no
episode.summary: A new found passion has brought Misuzawa back into the fight, as Chihaya herself tries to fight through the pain of her injury. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ふくからに
Gust of Wind
Fuku kara ni
episode.summary: Fujisaka training has proven to be a major hurdle to Mizusawa thanks to the training regimen demanded by their coach, Sakurazawa. Rion continues her lead over Chihaya thanks to her familiarity of the reader’s voice. Doubts and injury plague Chihaya and her team as they fight to stay in the game. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: あきのたの
The Fall Paddy Shacks
Aki no Ta no
episode.summary: The Mizusawa karuta club has won the team championship, becomming the number one team in Japan. The players reflect upon the path they took to the championship. After Chihaya remembers the pain in her finger, she is taken to the hospital. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ゆくへもしらぬ こひのみちかな
I Do Not Know Where This Love Will Take Me
Yuku e mo Shiranu Koi no Michi kana
episode.summary: Three wins for the victory. Taichi`s declaration provides encouragement to the remaining players. The Mizusawa karuta club uses all of their experience and practice to fight to the end. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: めぐりあひて
Long Last We Meet
Meguriaite
episode.summary: Chihaya has advanced to the quarterfinals. Her opponent is the Queen, Wakamiya Shinobu. Chihaya decides to go all in and use her injured right hand. How will Shinobu respond? How will Chihaya fare? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: なこそながれて なほきこえけれ
But Its Legacy Continues to Spread
Na koso Nagarete Nao Kikoekere
episode.summary: Chihaya has injured her right hand, so she`s forced to play with her left. Her first opponent is Yuube, from Akashi First Girls. Chihaya struggles to take cards with her left hand. Will she be able to make it past the first round? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ふじのたかねに ゆきはふりつつ
I Can Look up and See the Snowy Cap of Mt. Fuji
Fuji no Takane ni Yuki wa Furitsutsu
episode.summary: With winners and losers riding emotional waves, Chihaya is sent a video of the Class A final and while watching it stirs of memories of playing Karuta with Arata. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: かくとだに
When I Must Hide...
Kaku to dani
episode.summary: With a packed house watching who could be the new King and Queen, Chihaya and Taichi are ushered in by Sakurazawa. The atmosphere is tense; who will win? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: をのへのさくら さきにけり
To See the Beautiful Cherry Blossoms
Onoe no Sakura Sakinikeri
episode.summary: The Class A Finals pit Arata vs Shinobu, Class B is between Taichi and Rion in the same area where Komano is participating in the Class C Final. Chihaya is stuck between supporting Taichi and Komano or experiencing the match between Arata and Shinobu. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 制作発表記者会見ダイジェスト
Special 2
Seisaku Happyou Kisha Kaiken Digest
放送記念! 人気声優オフレコ!? 女子トークSP (特別バージョン)
Special 1
Housou Kinen! Ninki Seiyuu Offreco!? Joshi Talk SP (Tokubetsu Version)
超豪華! 人気声優大集合!! 瑞沢かるた部夏合宿! 苦しい時の右下段SP!
Special 3
Chougouka! Ninki Seiyuu Daishuugou!! Mizusawa Karuta-bu Natsu Gasshuku! Kurushii Toki no Migi Gedan SP!
